title: Authors and Citation
text: Mattioni Maturana F (2022). lactater: Tools Analyzing Lactate Thresholds. R package version 0.1.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {lactater: Tools for Analyzing Lactate Thresholds},   author = {Felipe {Mattioni Maturana}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.1}, }

title: Tools for Analyzing Lactate Thresholds
text: goal lactater provide tools making easier analyze lactate thresholds.

title: Tools for Analyzing Lactate Thresholds
text: can install released version lactater CRAN : can install development version lactater Github :

title: Tools for Analyzing Lactate Thresholds
text: lactater can easily estimate lactate thresholds using one multiple methods:
code: results_overall <- lactate_threshold(   .data = demo_data,    intensity_column = "intensity",    lactate_column = "lactate",    heart_rate_column = "heart_rate",   method = c("Log-log", "OBLA", "Bsln+", "Dmax", "LTP", "LTratio"),   fit = "3rd degree polynomial",    include_baseline = TRUE,    sport = "cycling",   plot = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 17 × 7 #>    method_category method           fitting   intensity lactate heart_rate plot  #>    <fct>           <fct>            <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl>      <dbl> <lis> #>  1 Log-log         Log-log          3rd degr…      68.3    1.2         131 <gg>  #>  2 OBLA            OBLA 2.0         3rd degr…     105.     2           153 <gg>  #>  3 OBLA            OBLA 2.5         3rd degr…     118.     2.5         160 <gg>  #>  4 OBLA            OBLA 3.0         3rd degr…     129      3           167 <gg>  #>  5 OBLA            OBLA 3.5         3rd degr…     137      3.5         171 <gg>  #>  6 OBLA            OBLA 4.0         3rd degr…     145      4           176 <gg>  #>  7 Bsln+           Bsln + 0.5       3rd degr…      82.5    1.43        139 <gg>  #>  8 Bsln+           Bsln + 1.0       3rd degr…     104.     1.93        152 <gg>  #>  9 Bsln+           Bsln + 1.5       3rd degr…     117.     2.43        159 <gg>  #> 10 Dmax            Dmax             3rd degr…     132.     3.1         168 <gg>  #> 11 Dmax            ModDmax          3rd degr…     140.     3.6         173 <gg>  #> 12 Dmax            Exp-Dmax         Exponent…     135.     3.3         170 <gg>  #> 13 Dmax            Log-Poly-ModDmax 3rd degr…     137.     3.4         172 <gg>  #> 14 Dmax            Log-Exp-ModDmax  Exponent…     141.     3.6         174 <gg>  #> 15 LTP             LTP1             3rd degr…      88.9    1.5         143 <gg>  #> 16 LTP             LTP2             3rd degr…     148.     4.1         178 <gg>  #> 17 LTratio         LTratio          B-Spline…      71.2    1.2         132 <gg>

title: Demo data — demo_data
text: dataset containing lactate heart rate data collected step-incremental test example

title: Demo data — demo_data
text: data frame 8 rows 5 variables: step number step, starting zero baseline. length length step. intensity intensity performed step (case watts). lactate blood lactate concentration. heart_rate heart rate associated step.

title: Produce data protocol skeleton — helper_data_protocol
text: internal function used run_data_input().

title: Produce data protocol skeleton — helper_data_protocol
code: helper_data_protocol(   input_steps,   input_length_steps,   input_starting_load,   input_step_increase,   input_heart_rate_data,   input_completed,   input_last_length_step,   sport )

title: Produce data protocol skeleton — helper_data_protocol
text: input_steps total number steps incremental test. input_length_steps length step, minutes. input_starting_load starting load. input_step_increase step increase. input_heart_rate_data boolean indicating whether heart rate data collected. input_completed boolean indicating whether last step fully completed. input_last_length_step last step fully completed, indicate long lasted. sport sport incremental test performed. One cycling, running, swimming.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: general function applies several lactate threshold methods time.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
code: lactate_threshold(   .data,   intensity_column,   lactate_column,   heart_rate_column,   method = c("Log-log", "OBLA", "Bsln+", "Dmax", "LTP", "LTratio"),   fit = c("3rd degree polynomial", "4th degree polynomial", "B-spline"),   include_baseline = FALSE,   sport = c("cycling", "running", "swimming"),   loglog_restrainer = 1,   plot = TRUE )

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: .data raw data. intensity_column name intensity column. lactate_column name lactate column. heart_rate_column name heart rate column, applicable. method lactate threshold method calculate. can one many following: Log-log, OBLA, Bsln+, Dmax, LTP, LTratio. See Details information. Default c("Log-log", "OBLA", "Bsln+", "Dmax", "LTP", "LTratio"). fit fit like use finding lactate values associated one lactate thresholds. Please, note lactate thresholds default methods changed. Options 3rd degree polynomial, 4th degree polynomial, B-spline. See Details. include_baseline boolean indicate whether include baseline value fit. sport sport incremental test performed. One cycling, running, swimming. loglog_restrainer scalar 0 1 indicating percentage data like restrain fitting Log-Log method. example, 1 means restriction (fits using whole data), 0.5 means first 50% data used. Default 1. plot boolean indicate whether generate plot one methods. Default TRUE.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: tibble following columns: method_category category lactate threshold method. method method used estimate lactate threshold fitting fitting method used predict lactate curve intensity intensity associated estimated lactate threshold lactate lactate concentration associated estimated lactate threshold heart_rate heart rate associated estimated lactate threshold plot plot produced display lactate threshold

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: lactate response (.e., log lactate vs intensity) divided two segments. segmented regression performed lactate curve present one breaking point. exercise intensity breaking point occurs considered Log-log (Beaver et al., 1985). Caution: method might require double-check via visual inspection, depending cases.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: Onset Blood Lactate Accumulation (OBLA) exercise intensity fixed lactate 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 3.5, 4.0 mmol/L (Heck et al., 1985, Kindermann et al., 1979; Skinner & Mclellan, 1980). lactate curve usually fitted using 3rd order polynomial regression curve, user can define another method (4th degree polynomial B-spline).

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: baseline plus method (Bsln+), exercise intensity lactate increases 0.5, 1.0, 1.5 mmol/L baseline (resting) values considered (Berg et al., 1990; Zoladz et al., 1995). lactate curve usually fitted using 3rd order polynomial regression curve, user can define another method (4th degree polynomial B-spline).

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: exercise intensity yields maximum perpendicular distance straight line first last data point (Cheng et al., 1992). lactate curve fitted using 3rd order polynomial regression curve, changed.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: exercise intensity yields maximum perpendicular distance straight line data point preceding first rise lactate greater 0.4 mmol/L last data point (Bishop et al., 1998). lactate curve fitted using 3rd order polynomial regression curve, changed.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: exercise intensity exponential plus-constant regression lactate curve yields maximum perpendicular distance straight line first last data point (Hughson et al., 1987). lactate curve fitted using exponential curve, changed.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: exercise intensity yields maximum perpendicular distance straight line Log-log last data point 3rd order polynomial regression curve (Jamnick et al., 2018). lactate curve fitted using 3rd order polynomial regression curve, changed.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: exercise intensity yields maximum perpendicular distance straight line Log-log last data point exponential curve (Jamnick et al., 2018). lactate curve fitted using exponential curve, changed.

what: Lactate Turning Point 1 (LTP1) and Lactate Turning Point 2 (LTP2)
title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: lactate response divided three segments. segmented regression performed lactate curve yields two breaking points. first breaking point, representing first rise lactate resting levels, considered LTP1. second breaking point, representing accelerated lactate accumulation, considered LTP2 (Hofmann & Tschakert, 2017; Hofmann et al., 1997; Pokan et al., 1997). Caution: method might require double-check via visual inspection, depending cases.

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: lactate response (.e., ratio lactate / exercise intensity vs exercise intensity) interpolated using B-spline regression curve. LTratio defined lowest value lactate / exercise intensity ratio, attempts describe onset lactate increase (Dickhuth et al., 1999).

title: Lactate threshold — lactate_threshold
text: Beaver WL, Wasserman K, Whipp BJ. Improved detection lactate threshold exercise using log-log transformation. Journal Applied Physiology. 1985;59(6):1936–40. Heck H, Mader , Hess G, Mücke S, Müller R, Hollmann W. Justification 4-mmol/l Lactate Threshold. International Journal Sports Medicine. 1985;06(03):117–30. Kindermann W, Simon G, Keul J. significance aerobic-anaerobic transition determination work load intensities endurance training. European Journal Applied Physiology Occupational Physiology. 1979;42(1):25–34. Skinner JS, Mclellan TH. Transition Aerobic Anaerobic Metabolism. Research Quarterly Exercise Sport. 1980;51(1):234–48. Berg , Jakob E, Lehmann M, Dickhuth HH, Huber G, Keul J. Current aspects modern ergometry. Pneumologie. 1990;44(1):2–13. Zoladz JA, Rademaker AC, Sargeant AJ. Non-linear relationship O2 uptake power output high intensities exercise humans. Journal Physiology. 1995;488(1):211–7. Cheng B, Kuipers H, Snyder , Keizer H, Jeukendrup , Hesselink M. New Approach Determination Ventilatory Lactate Thresholds. International Journal Sports Medicine. 1992;13(07):518–22. Bishop D, Jenkins DG, Mackinnon LT. relationship plasma lactate parameters, Wpeak 1-h cycling performance women. Med Sci Sports Exerc. 1998;30(8):1270–5. Hughson RL, Weisiger KH, Swanson GD. Blood lactate concentration increases continuous function progressive exercise. Journal Applied Physiology. 1987;62(5):1975–81. Jamnick NA, Botella J, Pyne DB, Bishop DJ. Manipulating graded exercise test variables affects validity lactate threshold VO2peak. PLOS ONE. 2018;13(7):e0199794. Hofmann P, Tschakert G. Intensity- Duration-Based Options Regulate Endurance Training. Front Physiol. 2017;8:337. Hofmann P, Pokan R, von Duvillard SP, Seibert FJ, Zweiker R, Schmid P. Heart rate performance curve incremental cycle ergometer exercise healthy young male subjects. Med Sci Sports Exerc. 1997;29(6):762–8. Pokan R, Hofmann P, Von Duvillard SP, et al. Left ventricular function response transition aerobic anaerobic metabolism. Med Sci Sports Exerc. 1997;29(8):1040–7. Dickhuth H-H, Yin L, Niess , et al. Ventilatory, Lactate-Derived Catecholamine Thresholds Incremental Treadmill Running: Relationship Reproducibility. International Journal Sports Medicine. 1999;20(02):122–7.

what: lactater: Tools for Analyzing Lactate Thresholds — lactater-package
title: lactater: Tools for Analyzing Lactate Thresholds — lactater-package
text: Set tools analyzing lactate thresholds step incremental test exhaustion. Easily analyze methods Log-log, Onset Blood Lactate Accumulation (OBLA), Baseline plus (Bsln+), Dmax, Lactate Turning Point (LTP), Lactate / Intensity ratio (LTratio) cycling, running, swimming. Beaver WL, Wasserman K, Whipp BJ (1985) <doi:10.1152/jappl.1985.59.6.1936>. Heck H, Mader , Hess G, Mücke S, Müller R, Hollmann W (1985) <doi:10.1055/s-2008-1025824>. Kindermann W, Simon G, Keul J (1979) <doi:10.1007/BF00421101>. Skinner JS, Mclellan TH (1980) <doi:10.1080/02701367.1980.10609285>. Berg , Jakob E, Lehmann M, Dickhuth HH, Huber G, Keul J (1990) <PMID:2408033>. Zoladz JA, Rademaker AC, Sargeant AJ (1995) <doi:10.1113/jphysiol.1995.sp020959>. Cheng B, Kuipers H, Snyder , Keizer H, Jeukendrup , Hesselink M (1992) <doi:10.1055/s-2007-1021309>. Bishop D, Jenkins DG, Mackinnon LT (1998) <doi:10.1097/00005768-199808000-00014>. Hughson RL, Weisiger KH, Swanson GD (1987) <doi:10.1152/jappl.1987.62.5.1975>. Jamnick NA, Botella J, Pyne DB, Bishop DJ (2018) <doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0199794>. Hofmann P, Tschakert G (2017) <doi:10.3389/fphys.2017.00337>. Hofmann P, Pokan R, von Duvillard SP, Seibert FJ, Zweiker R, Schmid P (1997) <doi:10.1097/00005768-199706000-00005>. Pokan R, Hofmann P, Von Duvillard SP, et al. (1997) <doi:10.1097/00005768-199708000-00009>. Dickhuth H-H, Yin L, Niess , et al. (1999) <doi:10.1055/s-2007-971105>.

title: Prepare fit — prepare_fit

title: Prepare fit — prepare_fit
text: .data data retrieved prepare_data(). fit fit like use finding lactate values associated one lactate thresholds. Please, note lactate thresholds default methods changed. See Details. include_baseline boolean indicate whether include baseline value fit. sport sport incremental test performed. One cycling, running, swimming.
